column2: OREGON DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
column4: Oregon
column6: OR

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. A flashing red light:
column4: means that you must bring your vehicle to a complete halt.
column6: means the same thing as a stop sign.
column8: is used at dangerous intersections.

column2: 2. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.
column6: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column8: Take your foot off the gas and shift to neutral.
column10: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.

column2: 3. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column4: before you enter the intersection.
column6: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.
column8: only if the traffic signal turns red.

column2: 4. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column4: signal the train to stop.
column6: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.
column8: get back into the vehicle.

column2: 5. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Rub your tires on the curb to slow your car.
column6: Apply the parking brake slowly.
column8: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.

column2: 6. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column4: Get enough sleep.
column6: Schedule regular stops for every couple of hours.
column8: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: Stop if necessary
column6: Road narrows ahead
column8: Slow down or stop

column2: 8. Blind spots are:
column4: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column6: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
column8: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.

column2: 9. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.
column6: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.
column8: a narrow road ahead.

column2: 10. When you approach a stopped public transit bus from behind, you must yield to the bus:
column4: when the bus has its emergency lights on.
column6: only when it is not safe to pass the bus.
column8: only if it doesn't appear safe to proceed.
column10: when the bus has its turn signal and flashing yield sign on.

column2: 11. If an aggressive driver is behind you:
column4: increase you speed and flash your brake lights.
column6: try to get out of the aggressive driver’s way.
column8: slow down and confront the aggressive driver.
column10: sound your horn and move to the left lane.

column2: 12. ________ is the only effective way to reduce your Blood Alcohol Content (BAC).
column4: Drinking coffee
column6: Eating food
column8: Taking a cold shower

column2: 13. When you see flashing amber lights near the top of a school bus, you should know that:
column4: you must stop and remain stopped until the amber lights stop flashing.
column6: the bus has finished loading or unloading children. You may proceed.
column8: the bus is about to stop to load or unload children. Prepare to stop.
column10: the bus is loading or unloading children. Proceed slowly.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column4: No right turn
column6: No left turn
column8: Narrow Bridge

column2: 15. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column4: A stop sign.
column6: A police officer.
column8: A flashing red light.

column2: 16. To keep your vehicle from rolling into traffic when parked on a hill, if you are facing uphill you should:
column4: turn the back wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.
column6: set the parking brake and keep the front wheels straight.
column8: turn the front wheels away from the curb or edge of the road.
column10: turn the front wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.

column2: 17. This sign tells drivers:
column4: they may not turn right or left during the red light.
column6: turning right on red is forbidden.
column8: they must wait for the traffic signal to turn green before turning right or left.

column2: 18. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column4: Replacing worn wiper blades.
column6: Keeping your windows clean and clear.
column8: Making sure there is enough windshield fluid in the reservoir.

column2: 19. More than one vehicle is approaching a four-way stop sign. Who has the right of way?
column4: No one.
column6: The last driver to reach the intersection.
column8: The driver on the left.
column10: The first driver to reach the intersection and stop.

column2: 20. This sign means:
column4: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.
column6: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.
column8: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.
column10: The recommended speed limit is 45 MPH.

column2: 21. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.
column6: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
column8: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.

column2: 22. Destination signs are ______ with ____ letters and symbols.
column4: yellow; black
column6: white; black
column8: green; white

column2: 23. The yield sign means:
column4: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.
column6: The traffic light will soon be red.
column8: Drive with caution in wet weather.
column10: You must come to a complete stop.

column2: 24. The minimum drinking age in this State is ____ years.
25. Before backing up, you should:
column4: get off the car to see if it is clear to proceed.
column6: turn your head and look through the rear window.
column8: flash your headlights.
column10: rely on your mirrors to see if it is clear to proceed.

column2: 26. Parking is not allowed:
column4: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.
column6: on public roads
column8: within 250 feet of a traffic light.
column10: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.

column2: 27. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.
column6: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.
column8: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.

column2: 28. This sign is a:
column4: guide sign.
column6: regulatory sign.
column8: stop sign.

column2: 29. What does a flashing red light mean?
column4: NO TURN ON RED.
column6: Yield.
column8: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column10: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 30. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: avoid scanning the road ahead.
column6: keep one hand on the steering wheel.
column8: keep your eyes moving.
column10: use the vehicle ahead as your only points of focus.

column2: 31. Who is most at risk?
column4: Long-distance commuters.
column6: Drivers who are fatigued.
column8: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.

column2: 32. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.
column6: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.
column8: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.

column2: 33. When driving near light rail vehicles, drivers should:
column4: expect trains on any track at any time.
column6: always obey signs and traffic signals.
column8: never drive around lowered crossing gates.

column2: 34. You are approaching an intersection with a yellow flashing light. You should:
column4: speed up to beat the red light.
column6: proceed with caution through the intersection.
column8: prepare to stop; the light is about to turn red.
column10: stop and wait for the light to change.

column2: 35. This road sign means:
column4: Side road
column6: Construction zone ahead
column8: Sharp turn, slow down
